summary: The Great Pyramid of Giza, built around 2600 BC, is the largest Egyptian pyramid and the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. It was the tomb of pharaoh Khufu and took about 26 years to construct. Initially standing at 481 feet, it was the world's tallest structure for over 3,800 years. Made of around 2.3 million blocks, it used local limestone and imported granite and white limestone. Inside are three chambers, including the King's Chamber with a granite sarcophagus. Hemiunu, Khufu's vizier, is believed to have designed it. The pyramid is part of a larger complex with temples, smaller pyramids, and buried solar boats.
title: Great Pyramid of Giza
